title.raw: 《宋微子世家》 House of Song Wei Zi

sentences.zh: 微子開者，殷帝乙之首子而帝紂之庶兄也。

translations.literal: Wei Zi Kai was Yin Emperor Yi first son and Emperor Zhou concubine elder brother.
translations.idiomatic: Wei Zi Kai was Emperor Yi of Yin's eldest son and Emperor Zhou's elder half-brother.

sentences.zh: 紂既立，不明，淫亂於政，微子數諫，紂不聽。

translations.literal: Zhou already established, not enlightened, licentious chaos in government, Wei Zi frequently admonished, Zhou not listen.
translations.idiomatic: Zhou was already established but unenlightened. He was licentious and chaotic in government. Wei Zi frequently admonished him, but Zhou would not listen.

sentences.zh: 及祖伊以周西伯昌之修德，滅黎國，懼禍至，以告紂。

translations.literal: And Zu Yi with Zhou Xi Bo Chang cultivate virtue, extinguish Li state, feared calamity arrive, told Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: And Zu Yi, because Zhou's Xi Bo Chang cultivated virtue and extinguished the Li state, feared calamity would arrive, so he told Zhou.

sentences.zh: 紂曰：「我生不有命在天乎？

translations.literal: Zhou said: 'I born not have fate in heaven?'
translations.idiomatic: Zhou said: 'Don't I have my fate in heaven?'

sentences.zh: 是何能為！」

translations.literal: This what can do!'
translations.idiomatic: What can this do!'

sentences.zh: 於是微子度紂終不可諫，欲死之，及去，未能自決，乃問於太師、少師曰：「殷不有治政，不治四方。

translations.literal: Then Wei Zi measured Zhou finally not admonishable, desired die for it, and go, not able self decide, then asked Tai Shi, Shao Shi said: 'Yin not have governing politics, not governing four directions.
translations.idiomatic: Then Wei Zi realized Zhou could finally not be admonished. He desired to die for it, and when he was about to leave, he could not decide for himself. He then asked the Tai Shi and Shao Shi, saying: 'Yin does not have governing politics, does not govern the four directions.

sentences.zh: 我祖遂陳於上，紂沈湎於酒，婦人是用，亂敗湯德於下。

translations.literal: My ancestor Sui displayed above, Zhou immersed in wine, women used, chaos defeated Tang virtue below.
translations.idiomatic: My ancestor Sui displayed his virtue above. Zhou is immersed in wine and uses women, chaotically defeating Tang's virtue below.

sentences.zh: 殷既小大好草竊姦宄，卿士師師非度，皆有罪辜，乃無維獲，小民乃并興，相為敵讎。

translations.literal: Yin already small great good bandit thief wicked evildoers, qing shi shi shi not measure, all have crime guilt, then no support obtain, small people then together rise, mutually enemy foes.
translations.idiomatic: Yin already, from small to great, delights in bandits, thieves, wicked evildoers. The qing and shi shi shi not according to measure, all have crime and guilt. Then there is no support to obtain. The small people then all rise up together, becoming enemies and foes to each other.

sentences.zh: 今殷其典喪！

translations.literal: Now Yin its rules lost!
translations.idiomatic: Now Yin has lost its rules!

sentences.zh: 若涉水無津涯。

translations.literal: Like ford water no bank shore.
translations.idiomatic: Like fording water with no bank or shore.

sentences.zh: 殷遂喪，越至于今。」

translations.literal: Yin then perished, extend to now.'
translations.idiomatic: Yin has then perished, extending to the present.'

sentences.zh: 曰：「太師，少師，我其發出往？

translations.literal: Said: 'Tai Shi, Shao Shi, I should set out go?'
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'Tai Shi, Shao Shi, should I set out and go?'

sentences.zh: 吾家保于喪？

translations.literal: My family preserve in perished?'
translations.idiomatic: Should my family be preserved in the perished state?'

sentences.zh: 今女無故告予，顛躋，如之何其？」

translations.literal: Now you without reason tell me, fall stumble, like what how its?'
translations.idiomatic: Now you tell me without reason, falling and stumbling—what should I do about it?'

sentences.zh: 太師若曰：「王子，天篤下菑亡殷國，乃毋畏畏，不用老長。

translations.literal: Tai Shi Ruo said: 'Prince, heaven thickly down calamity perish Yin state, then not fear fear, not use elders.
translations.idiomatic: The Tai Shi Ruo said: 'Prince, heaven has thickly sent down calamity to perish the Yin state. Then do not fear fear, do not use the elders.

sentences.zh: 今殷民乃陋淫神祇之祀。

translations.literal: Now Yin people then vulgar licentious spirits sacrifices.
translations.idiomatic: Now the Yin people are vulgar and licentiously sacrificing to the spirits.

sentences.zh: 今誠得治國，國治身死不恨。

translations.literal: Now truly obtain govern state, state govern body die not regret.
translations.idiomatic: Now if I truly obtain to govern the state, govern the state and my body dies—I will not regret it.

sentences.zh: 為死，終不得治，不如去。」

translations.literal: For death, finally not obtain govern, not as good go.'
translations.idiomatic: To die, and finally not obtain to govern—not as good as to go.'

sentences.zh: 遂亡。

translations.literal: Then fled.
translations.idiomatic: He then fled.

sentences.zh: 箕子者，紂親戚也。

translations.literal: Ji Zi was Zhou relative.
translations.idiomatic: Ji Zi was Zhou's relative.

sentences.zh: 紂始為象箸，箕子嘆曰：「彼為象箸，必為玉桮；

translations.literal: Zhou began make ivory chopsticks, Ji Zi sighed said: 'He make ivory chopsticks, must make jade cup;
translations.idiomatic: Zhou began to make ivory chopsticks. Ji Zi sighed and said: 'He makes ivory chopsticks, he must make jade cups;

sentences.zh: 為桮，則必思遠方珍怪之物而御之矣。

translations.literal: Make cup, then must think distant places precious strange things and use them.
translations.idiomatic: To make a cup, one must then think of precious and strange things from distant places and use them.

sentences.zh: 輿馬宮室之漸自此始，不可振也。」

translations.literal: Chariot horse palace chamber gradual from this begin, cannot revive.'
translations.idiomatic: The gradual development of chariots, horses, palaces, and chambers begins from this. It cannot be revived.'

sentences.zh: 紂為淫泆，箕子諫，不聽。

translations.literal: Zhou made licentious excess, Ji Zi admonished, not listen.
translations.idiomatic: Zhou committed licentious excesses. Ji Zi admonished him, but he would not listen.

sentences.zh: 人或曰：「可以去矣。」

translations.literal: People or said: 'Can go.'
translations.idiomatic: Some people said: 'You can go.'

sentences.zh: 箕子曰：「為人臣諫不聽而去，是彰君之惡而自說於民，吾不忍為也。」

translations.literal: Ji Zi said: 'Be minister admonish not listen and go, is display lord evil and self please to people, I not endure do.'
translations.idiomatic: Ji Zi said: 'To be a minister, admonish but not be listened to and then go—this displays the lord's evil and pleases oneself to the people. I cannot bear to do this.'

sentences.zh: 乃被髪詳狂而為奴。

translations.literal: Then disheveled hair pretended mad became slave.
translations.idiomatic: He then disheveled his hair, pretended to be mad, and became a slave.

sentences.zh: 遂隱而鼓琴以自悲，故傳之曰箕子操。

translations.literal: Then hid and played zither to self grieve, therefore transmitted called Ji Zi Cao.
translations.idiomatic: He then hid himself and played the zither to grieve for himself. Therefore it is transmitted as the Ji Zi Cao.

sentences.zh: 王子比干者，亦紂之親戚也。

translations.literal: Prince Bi Gan was also Zhou relative.
translations.idiomatic: Prince Bi Gan was also Zhou's relative.

sentences.zh: 見箕子諫不聽而為奴，則曰：「君有過而不以死爭，則百姓何辜！」

translations.literal: Saw Ji Zi admonish not listen became slave, then said: 'Lord has error not with death contend, then hundred surnames what guilt!'
translations.idiomatic: He saw Ji Zi admonish but not be listened to and become a slave. He then said: 'If the lord has errors and one does not contend with death, then what guilt do the common people have!'

sentences.zh: 乃直言諫紂。

translations.literal: Then straightforwardly admonished Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: He then straightforwardly admonished Zhou.

sentences.zh: 紂怒曰：「吾聞聖人之心有七竅，信有諸乎？」

translations.literal: Zhou angered said: 'I heard sage person heart has seven apertures, truly has it?'
translations.idiomatic: Zhou was angered and said: 'I heard that a sage person's heart has seven apertures. Is this truly so?'

sentences.zh: 乃遂殺王子比干，刳視其心。

translations.literal: Then killed Prince Bi Gan, cut open viewed his heart.
translations.idiomatic: He then killed Prince Bi Gan, cut him open, and viewed his heart.

sentences.zh: 微子曰：「父子有骨肉，而臣主以義屬。

translations.literal: Wei Zi said: 'Father son have bone flesh, minister lord with righteousness belong.
translations.idiomatic: Wei Zi said: 'Father and son have bone and flesh connections, while minister and lord belong through righteousness.

sentences.zh: 故父有過，子三諫不聽，則隨而號之；

translations.literal: Therefore father has error, son three admonish not listen, then follow cry for him;
translations.idiomatic: Therefore if a father has errors, a son admonishes three times but is not listened to, then he follows and cries for him;

sentences.zh: 人臣三諫不聽，則其義可以去矣。」

translations.literal: Minister three admonish not listen, then righteousness can go.'
translations.idiomatic: If a minister admonishes three times but is not listened to, then in righteousness he can leave.'

sentences.zh: 於是太師、少師乃勸微子去，遂行。

translations.literal: Then Tai Shi, Shao Shi urged Wei Zi go, then went.
translations.idiomatic: Then the Tai Shi and Shao Shi urged Wei Zi to go, and he then went.

sentences.zh: 周武王伐紂克殷，微子乃持其祭器造於軍門，肉袒面縛，左牽羊，右把茅，膝行而前以告。

translations.literal: Zhou Wu Wang attacked Zhou conquered Yin, Wei Zi then held his sacrificial vessels went to army gate, bare flesh face bound, left led sheep, right grasped thatch, knee walked forward to tell.
translations.idiomatic: Zhou's King Wu attacked Zhou and conquered Yin. Wei Zi then held his sacrificial vessels and went to the army gate, bare flesh and bound face, left hand leading a sheep, right hand grasping thatch, knee-walking forward to inform.

sentences.zh: 於是武王乃釋微子，復其位如故。

translations.literal: Then Wu Wang released Wei Zi, restored his position as before.
translations.idiomatic: Then King Wu released Wei Zi and restored his position as before.

sentences.zh: 武王封紂子武庚祿父以續殷祀，使管叔、蔡叔傅相之。

translations.literal: Wu Wang enfeoffed Zhou son Wu Geng Lu Fu to continue Yin sacrifices, made Guan Shu, Cai Shu tutor assist him.
translations.idiomatic: King Wu enfeoffed Zhou's son Wu Geng Lu Fu to continue the Yin sacrifices, and made Guan Shu and Cai Shu tutor and assist him.

sentences.zh: 武王既克殷，訪問箕子。

translations.literal: Wu Wang already conquered Yin, inquired Ji Zi.
translations.idiomatic: King Wu had already conquered Yin and inquired of Ji Zi.

sentences.zh: 武王曰：「於乎！

translations.literal: Wu Wang said: 'Alas!'
translations.idiomatic: King Wu said: 'Alas!'

sentences.zh: 維天陰定下民，相和其居，我不知其常倫所序。」

translations.literal: Only heaven secretly settles lower people, mutually harmonize their residence, I not know its constant order where arranged.'
translations.idiomatic: Only heaven secretly settles the lower people, mutually harmonizing their residences. I do not know where its constant order is arranged.'

sentences.zh: 箕子對曰：「在昔鯀陻鴻水，汨陳其五行，帝乃震怒，不從鴻範九等，常倫所斁。

translations.literal: Ji Zi replied said: 'In former times Gun dammed great water, confused displayed its five phases, Emperor then angrily shook, not followed great pattern nine grades, constant order where abandoned.
translations.idiomatic: Ji Zi replied, saying: 'In former times Gun dammed the great water and confusedly displayed its five phases. The Emperor then angrily shook and did not follow the great pattern's nine grades. The constant order was where it was abandoned.

sentences.zh: 鯀則殛死，禹乃嗣興。

translations.literal: Gun then executed died, Yu then succeeded rose.
translations.idiomatic: Gun was then executed and died. Yu then succeeded and rose.

sentences.zh: 天乃錫禹鴻範九等，常倫所序。

translations.literal: Heaven then granted Yu great pattern nine grades, constant order where arranged.
translations.idiomatic: Heaven then granted Yu the great pattern's nine grades, where the constant order was arranged.

sentences.zh: 「初一曰五行；

translations.literal: 'First one called five phases;
translations.idiomatic: 'The first is called the five phases;

sentences.zh: 二曰五事；

translations.literal: Second called five matters;
translations.idiomatic: The second is called the five matters;

sentences.zh: 三曰八政；

translations.literal: Third called eight governments;
translations.idiomatic: The third is called the eight governments;

sentences.zh: 四曰五紀；

translations.literal: Fourth called five records;
translations.idiomatic: The fourth is called the five records;

sentences.zh: 五曰皇極；

translations.literal: Fifth called royal pole;
translations.idiomatic: The fifth is called the royal pole;

sentences.zh: 六曰三德；

translations.literal: Sixth called three virtues;
translations.idiomatic: The sixth is called the three virtues;

sentences.zh: 七曰稽疑；

translations.literal: Seventh called examine doubts;
translations.idiomatic: The seventh is called examining doubts;

sentences.zh: 八曰庶徵；

translations.literal: Eighth called many signs;
translations.idiomatic: The eighth is called the many signs;

sentences.zh: 九曰嚮用五福，畏用六極。

translations.literal: Ninth called face use five blessings, fear use six extremes.
translations.idiomatic: The ninth is called facing using the five blessings, fearing using the six extremes.

sentences.zh: 「五行：一曰水，二曰火，三曰木，四曰金，五曰土。

translations.literal: 'Five phases: one called water, two called fire, three called wood, four called metal, five called earth.
translations.idiomatic: 'The five phases: one is called water, two is called fire, three is called wood, four is called metal, five is called earth.

sentences.zh: 水曰潤下，火曰炎上，木曰曲直，金曰從革，土曰稼穡。

translations.literal: Water called moisten down, fire called flame up, wood called bend straight, metal called follow change, earth called plow harvest.
translations.idiomatic: Water is called moistening downward. Fire is called flaming upward. Wood is called bending and straightening. Metal is called following change. Earth is called plowing and harvesting.

sentences.zh: 潤下作鹹，炎上作苦，曲直作酸，從革作辛，稼穡作甘。

translations.literal: Moisten down makes salty, flame up makes bitter, bend straight makes sour, follow change makes pungent, plow harvest makes sweet.
translations.idiomatic: Moistening downward makes salty. Flaming upward makes bitter. Bending and straightening makes sour. Following change makes pungent. Plowing and harvesting makes sweet.

sentences.zh: 「五事：一曰貌，二曰言，三曰視，四曰聽，五曰思。

translations.literal: 'Five matters: one called appearance, two called speech, three called seeing, four called hearing, five called thinking.
translations.idiomatic: 'The five matters: one is called appearance, two is called speech, three is called seeing, four is called hearing, five is called thinking.

sentences.zh: 貌曰恭，言曰從，視曰明，聽曰聰，思曰睿。

translations.literal: Appearance called respectful, speech called compliant, seeing called clear, hearing called acute, thinking called profound.
translations.idiomatic: Appearance is called respectful. Speech is called compliant. Seeing is called clear. Hearing is called acute. Thinking is called profound.

sentences.zh: 恭作肅，從作治，明作智，聰作謀，睿作聖。

translations.literal: Respectful makes solemn, compliant makes orderly, clear makes wise, acute makes plan, profound makes sage.
translations.idiomatic: Respectful makes solemn. Compliant makes orderly. Clear makes wise. Acute makes plans. Profound makes sage.

sentences.zh: 「八政：一曰食，二曰貨，三曰祀，四曰司空，五曰司徒，六曰司寇，七曰賓，八曰師。

translations.literal: 'Eight governments: one called food, two called goods, three called sacrifices, four called Si Kong, five called Si Tu, six called Si Kou, seven called guests, eight called army.
translations.idiomatic: 'The eight governments: one is called food, two is called goods, three is called sacrifices, four is called Si Kong, five is called Si Tu, six is called Si Kou, seven is called guests, eight is called army.

sentences.zh: 「五紀：一曰歲，二曰月，三曰日，四曰星辰，五曰歷數。

translations.literal: 'Five records: one called year, two called month, three called day, four called stars planets, five called calendar numbers.
translations.idiomatic: 'The five records: one is called year, two is called month, three is called day, four is called stars and planets, five is called calendar numbers.

sentences.zh: 「皇極：皇建其有極，斂時五福，用傅錫其庶民，維時其庶民于女極，錫女保極。

translations.literal: 'Royal pole: king establishes his having pole, gathers timely five blessings, uses spread grant his common people, only then his common people at your pole, grant you preserve pole.
translations.idiomatic: 'The royal pole: the king establishes his having a pole, gathers the timely five blessings, uses them to spread and grant to his common people. Only then are his common people at your pole. Grant you to preserve the pole.

sentences.zh: 凡厥庶民，毋有淫朋，人毋有比德，維皇作極。

translations.literal: All their common people, not have licentious companions, people not have compare virtue, only king makes pole.
translations.idiomatic: All their common people shall not have licentious companions. People shall not have comparable virtue. Only the king makes the pole.

sentences.zh: 凡厥庶民，有猷有為有守，女則念之。

translations.literal: All their common people, have plan have action have hold, you then think of them.
translations.idiomatic: All their common people who have plans, have actions, have holdings—you then think of them.

sentences.zh: 不協于極，不離于咎，皇則受之。

translations.literal: Not agree at pole, not separate at calamity, king then accepts it.
translations.idiomatic: Not agreeing at the pole, not separating at calamity—the king then accepts it.

sentences.zh: 而安而色，曰予所好德，女則錫之福。

translations.literal: Their peaceful their appearance, said I what good virtue, you then grant them blessing.
translations.idiomatic: Their peaceful appearance—said 'I what good virtue'—you then grant them blessings.

sentences.zh: 時人斯其維皇之極。

translations.literal: Timely people this their only wang pole.
translations.idiomatic: Timely people—this is their only wang pole.

sentences.zh: 毋侮寡而畏高明。

translations.literal: Not insult few and fear high bright.
translations.idiomatic: Do not insult the few and fear the high and bright.

sentences.zh: 人之有能有為，使羞其行，而國其昌。

translations.literal: People having ability having action, make shame their conduct, and state its prosper.
translations.idiomatic: People who have ability and action—make them ashamed of their conduct, and the state will prosper.

sentences.zh: 凡厥正人，既富方穀。

translations.literal: All their upright people, already rich each valley.
translations.idiomatic: All their upright people are already rich in each valley.

sentences.zh: 女不能使有好于而家，時人斯其辜。

translations.literal: You cannot make have good at your family, timely people this their crime.
translations.idiomatic: You cannot make there be good in your family. Timely people—this is their crime.

sentences.zh: 于其毋好，女雖錫之福，其作女用咎。

translations.literal: At their not good, you though grant them blessing, their make you use calamity.
translations.idiomatic: At their not being good, though you grant them blessings, they will make you use calamity.

sentences.zh: 毋偏毋頗，遵王之義。

translations.literal: Not partial not inclined, follow wang righteousness.
translations.idiomatic: Not partial, not inclined—follow the wang's righteousness.

sentences.zh: 毋有作好，遵王之道。

translations.literal: Not have make good, follow wang way.
translations.idiomatic: Do not have making good—follow the wang's way.

sentences.zh: 毋有作惡，遵王之路。

translations.literal: Not have make evil, follow wang road.
translations.idiomatic: Do not have making evil—follow the wang's road.

sentences.zh: 毋偏毋黨，王道蕩蕩。

translations.literal: Not partial not faction, wang way broad broad.
translations.idiomatic: Not partial, not factional—the wang's way is broad and broad.

sentences.zh: 毋黨毋偏，王道平平。

translations.literal: Not faction not partial, wang way level level.
translations.idiomatic: Not factional, not partial—the wang's way is level and level.

sentences.zh: 毋反毋側，王道正直。

translations.literal: Not contrary not slanted, wang way straight upright.
translations.idiomatic: Not contrary, not slanted—the wang's way is straight and upright.

sentences.zh: 會其有極，歸其有極。

translations.literal: Gather their having pole, return their having pole.
translations.idiomatic: Gather their having a pole. Return their having a pole.

sentences.zh: 曰王極之傅言，是夷是訓，于帝其順。

translations.literal: Said wang pole spread words, this even this instruct, to emperor its compliant.
translations.idiomatic: The wang pole's spread words—this is even, this is instruction. To the emperor it is compliant.

sentences.zh: 凡厥庶民，極之傅言，是順是行，以近天子之光。

translations.literal: All their common people, pole spread words, this compliant this act, to approach tian zi light.
translations.idiomatic: All their common people—the pole's spread words—this is compliant, this is action, to approach the Tian Zi's light.

sentences.zh: 曰天子作民父母，以為天下王。

translations.literal: Said tian zi makes people parents, to be world wang.
translations.idiomatic: It is said the Tian Zi makes himself the people's parents, to be the wang of the world.

sentences.zh: 「三德：一曰正直，二曰剛克，三曰柔克。

translations.literal: 'Three virtues: one called upright straight, two called firm overcome, three called gentle overcome.
translations.idiomatic: 'The three virtues: one is called upright and straight, two is called firm overcoming, three is called gentle overcoming.

sentences.zh: 平康正直，彊不友剛克，內友柔克，沈漸剛克，高明柔克。

translations.literal: Peace calm upright straight, strong not friendly firm overcome, inner friendly gentle overcome, deep gradual firm overcome, high bright gentle overcome.
translations.idiomatic: Peace and calm are upright and straight. Strong but not friendly uses firm overcoming. Inner friendly uses gentle overcoming. Deep and gradual uses firm overcoming. High and bright uses gentle overcoming.

sentences.zh: 維辟作福，維辟作威，維辟玉食。

translations.literal: Only ruler makes blessing, only ruler makes awe, only ruler jade food.
translations.idiomatic: Only the ruler makes blessings. Only the ruler makes awe. Only the ruler has jade food.

sentences.zh: 臣無有作福作威玉食。

translations.literal: Ministers not have make blessing make awe jade food.
translations.idiomatic: Ministers shall not have making blessings, making awe, jade food.

sentences.zh: 臣有作福作威玉食，其害于而家，凶于而國，人用側頗辟，民用僭忒。

translations.literal: Ministers have make blessing make awe jade food, their harm at your family, calamitous at your state, people use slanted inclined ruler, people use presumptuous deviant.
translations.idiomatic: If ministers have making blessings, making awe, jade food—it harms your family, is calamitous for your state. People use slanted and inclined rulers. People use presumptuous and deviant ways.

sentences.zh: 「稽疑：擇建立卜筮人。

translations.literal: 'Examine doubts: select establish divination people.
translations.idiomatic: 'Examining doubts: select and establish divination people.

sentences.zh: 乃命卜筮，曰雨，曰濟，曰涕，曰霧，曰克，曰貞，曰悔，凡七。

translations.literal: Then command divination, called rain, called aid, called tear, called fog, called overcome, called upright, called regret, altogether seven.
translations.idiomatic: Then command divination: called rain, called aid, called tear, called fog, called overcome, called upright, called regret—altogether seven.

sentences.zh: 卜五，占之用二，衍貣。

translations.literal: Divine five, divine use two, extend greedy.
translations.idiomatic: Divine five times, use two for the divination, extend greedily.

sentences.zh: 立時人為卜筮，三人占則從二人之言。

translations.literal: Establish timely people as divination, three people divine then follow two people's words.
translations.idiomatic: Establish timely people as diviners. When three people divine, then follow two people's words.

translations.idiomatic: Called fog, constant wind as it should be.

translations.idiomatic: When the moon follows the stars, it then brings wind and rain.

sentences.zh: 「五福：一曰壽，二曰富，三曰康寧，四曰攸好德，五曰考終命。

sentences.zh: 殷民聞之，皆為流涕。

translations.literal: Wu Wang died, Cheng Wang young, Zhou Gong Dan substituted administered government held state.
translations.idiomatic: King Wu died. King Cheng was young. The Duke of Zhou Dan substituted and administered the government, holding the state.

translations.idiomatic: In the thirtieth year, Duke Hui died, and his son Duke Ai ascended.

translations.idiomatic: Duke Ai died in his first year, and his son Duke Dai ascended.

translations.idiomatic: Zi Yu said: 'The calamity is still not yet.'

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：孔子稱「微子去之，箕子為之奴，比干諫而死，殷有三仁焉」。

translations.literal: Grand Historian said: Kong Qiu praised 'Wei Zi left it, Ji Zi became slave for it, Bi Gan admonished and died, Yin had three benevolent.'
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Historian said: Kong Qiu praised 'Wei Zi left it, Ji Zi became a slave for it, Bi Gan admonished and died. Yin had three benevolent men.'

sentences.zh: 春秋譏宋之亂自宣公廢太子而立弟，國以不寧者十世。

translations.literal: Spring Autumn criticized Song chaos from Xuan Gong deposed crown prince and established younger brother, state not peaceful ten generations.
translations.idiomatic: The Spring and Autumn Annals criticized Song's chaos from Duke Xuan deposing the crown prince and establishing his younger brother. The state was not peaceful for ten generations.

sentences.zh: 襄公之時，修行仁義，欲為盟主。

translations.literal: Xiang Gong time, practiced benevolence righteousness, desired be alliance leader.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Xiang's time, he practiced benevolence and righteousness and desired to be the alliance leader.

sentences.zh: 其大夫正考父美之，故追道契、湯、高宗，殷所以興，作商頌。

translations.literal: His grand officer Zheng Kao Fu praised it, therefore traced way Jie, Tang, Gao Zong, Yin why rose, made Shang Song.
translations.idiomatic: His grand officer Zheng Kao Fu praised it, therefore traced the way of Jie, Tang, Gao Zong—why Yin rose—and made the Shang Song.

sentences.zh: 襄公既敗於泓，而君子或以為多，傷中國闕禮義，褒之也，宋襄之有禮讓也。

translations.literal: Xiang Gong already defeated at Hong, and gentlemen some considered excessive, hurt China lacking ritual righteousness, praised it, Song Xiang having ritual yielding.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xiang was already defeated at Hong, and some gentlemen considered it excessive, hurt China for lacking ritual and righteousness. They praised it—Song Xiang's having ritual and yielding.
